intro: Senecio hypomallus, commonly known as the narrowleaf groundsel, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a low-growing perennial that typically reaches a height of about 10 to 30 centimeters. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces yellow flowers in clusters during the warmer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Its botanical characteristics make it a notable species in the Asteraceae family.
